arm_group.description: ROX Coupler + continuing standard antihypertensive medications

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this registry is to evaluate the safety and performance of the ROX COUPLER in
      patients with treatment-resistant or uncontrolled hypertension.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry to Evaluate the ROX COUPLER in Patients With Resistant or Uncontrolled Hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of resistant or uncontrolled hypertension must be made on the basis of
             current findings, medical history, and physical examination.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any serious medical condition that may adversely affect the patient's safety, limit
             the subject's ability to participate in the registry, comply with follow-up
             requirements, or impact the scientific integrity of the study.

intervention.description: The COUPLER will be used to create an anastomosis in the iliac region (between the iliac artery and vein).

clinical_study.official_title: ROX CONTROL HTN Registry: To Evaluate the ROX Coupler in Patients With Resistant or Uncontrolled Hypertension

oversight_info.authority: England: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.description: Change in mean ambulatory daytime systolic blood pressure at six months as compared to Baseline.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in ambulatory daytime mean systolic blood pressure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in mean ambulatory daytime diastolic blood pressure at six months as compared to Baseline.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ambulatory daytime mean diastolic blood pressure

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
